Run a single-species JAGS model

Source: R/models_jags.R
jags_ss.Rd

Provides an API to run.jags for single-species portalcasting models that requires the user only provide the JAGS model, initializer, monitor, and control list.

jags_ss(
  main = ".",
  model_name = NULL,
  dataset = "all",
  settings = directory_settings(),
  control_runjags = runjags_control(),
  jags_model = NULL,
  monitor = NULL,
  inits = NULL,
  quiet = FALSE,
  verbose = FALSE
)

Arguments

main

character value of the name of the main component of the directory tree.

model_name

character value name of the model name to save in the cast tab.

dataset

character value name of the rodent data set, such as ("all" or "controls").

settings

list of controls for the directory, with defaults set in directory_settings that should generally not need to be altered.

control_runjags

list of arguments passed to run.jags via runjags_control

jags_model

character value of the model. See Examples.

monitor

character vector of the names of the variables to monitor. See Examples and run.jags.

inits

function, character vector, or list of values (including random number generation components) for initializing runs of the model. See Examples and run.jags.

quiet

logical value indicating if the function should be quiet.

verbose

logical indicator of whether or not to print out all of the information or not (and thus just the tidy messages).

Value

list of [1] model metadata list ("metadata"), [2] cast summary data.frame ("cast_tab"), [3] list of model fit objects ("model_fits"), and [4] list of model cast objects ("model_casts").

Details

The data structure constructed internally, which is available to the jags_model and inits components, contains the following elements: count, moon, and ntraps (all three include the forecast horizon as well, with NA for count, moon extended as expected, and ntraps using the max number of traps); N (the length of the count time series); past_count, past_moon, and past_ntraps, which provide all of the historic data that preceded start_moon (only including samples that are present; all NA counts are removed as are associated trap count sand moons); past_N (the length of the past_count time series); and if desired, covariates (table of all covariates for the span of moon). and past_covariates (table of all covariates for the span of past_moon).

References

Denwood, M. J. 2016. runjags: an R package providing interface utilities, model templates, parallel computing methods and additional distributions for MCMC models in JAGS. Journal of Statistical Software, 71:9. URL.

Plummer, M. 2003. JAGS: A program for analysis of Bayesian graphical models using Gibbs Sampling. Proceedings of the 3rd International Workshop on Distributed Statistical Computing (DSC 2003). ISSN 1609-395X. URL.

Contents
